title: Sentence structure for writers: understanding weight and clarity [extract]
excerpt: Some sentences just sound awkward. In order to ensure clarity, writers need to consider more than just grammar: weight is equally important. In the following extract from Making Sense, acclaimed linguist David Crystal shows how sentence length (and weight) affects writing quality.
highlights:
Highlight:What both these examples show is the importance of length, or weight.

Highlight:Both illustrate the principle of end-weight.

Highlight:A really long subject, especially one containing difficult words or concepts, may make such a demand on our working memory that we have to go back and read the sentence again,

title: 3 Rhetorical Techniques to Increase Your Impact
excerpt: Technological advances in natural language processing, computational linguistics, and machine learning, combined with the digitization of everything from cover letters to conversations, have revolutionized our ability to analyze language, yielding unprecedented insights. Think of it as a new science of language. Many of the findings suggest that small changes in the words we use can increase our ability to persuade and influence others.

title: The messages that survived civilisation's collapse - BBC Future
excerpt: The Sumerians, Maya and other ancient cultures created texts that have lasted hundreds and even thousands of years. Here's what they can teach us about crafting an immortal message.
